node.title: 'You would think we were in the middle of nowhere': In this fast-growing suburb, locals struggle to make a phone call
node.alt: Tamika sits on a couch holding her six-month old baby Amelie while using her laptop.
node.description: It's a 15-minute drive to world-class coastline, attractive to first home buyers, and one of Victoria's fastest-growing suburbs. But there's one issue that families are so fed up with, and they're breaking leases to move out.Â
node.content:
["When Tamika Cefai's phone rings, she almost never answers it.", "She's lucky if it starts ringing at all.", "It's not because she's afraid of who's calling or because she doesn't have time, Tamika doesn't answer because it's not worth it \u2014 the call will just cut out.", "Later, when she calls back, she takes the phone outside and walks a few metres down the street holding her phone high in the air searching for bars.", "If the signal from the street isn't enough she will get in the car and drive 10 minutes to the next suburb.", "\"You would think we were living in the middle of nowhere,\" she said.", "But she isn't, Tamika and her family live in Armstrong Creek; the fastest-growing suburb in one of\u00a0Australia's\u00a0fastest-growing regions:\u00a0Geelong.", "", "
Tamika has to go outside to make and take phone calls.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "But essential infrastructure hasn't kept up with the unwavering demand for affordable housing, and now, some of the suburb's 24,000 residents have decided to leave for places further afield just so they can take a call without fear of hanging up on someone.", "While the internet is slightly better, Tamika wouldn't call it reliable.", "\"We've\u00a0looked at changing providers, but given we are in contracts it was going to be too expensive for just the possibility of a little more internet and phone reception,\" she said.\u00a0", "", "
Tamika and her husband had to contend with internet drop outs during pandemic lockdowns.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "She tried using a booster but \"that didn't work at all\", she said.\u00a0\u00a0", "Others are investing in landlines so they can call triple-0 in an emergency or just to be able to call a friend without sitting on the nature strip.", "After the birth of her fifth daughter, Amelie, during last year's pandemic, a lack of reception meant Tamika became so isolated from friends and family she had to ask her mum to move in just so she could have a conversation with another adult.", "\"I couldn't have it any other way,\" she said.", "", "
Amelie was born three weeks early and Tamika struggled to make appointments so nurses could come and check up on her.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "
Coverage maps only 'a guide'
", "If Tamika had gone online before moving Armstrong Creek to look at connectivity coverage maps, she wouldn't have seen anything amiss.\u00a0", "According to those maps, Telstra, Optus and Vodafone supply 4G to the entirety of Armstrong Creek.\u00a0", "An Optus spokesperson said the maps \"accurately reflect reach from mobile towers\" and that \"other elements\" could affect service such as valleys and mountains.", "But that doesn't apply to Armstrong Creek which stretches flat from top to bottom.", "", "
Coverage maps are predictions based on different criteria depending on the company.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "Telstra general manager Jenny Gray said the maps were predictions, showing \"the expected outdoor and external antenna coverage for 3G, 4G and 5G Telstra services\".", "She added that Armstrong Creek was growing fast and it was a challenge to \"match construction with the demand for infrastructure\".", "A spokesperson for TPG Telecom, which owns Vodafone, also said coverage maps were \"a guide only\".\u00a0", "All three companies said they had plans to construct new mobile base station in the suburb in the coming years.", "", "
Armstrong Creek's population is predicted to hit at least 55,000 when the suburb is fully developed.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "The peak body for telecommunications customers, the Australian Communications Consumer Action Network (ACCAN), has made 48 recommendations to the federal government's Regional Telecommunications Independent Review Committee.", "It said over the last six years, the proportion of consumers just using a mobile phone to make calls had doubled, with 60 per cent of consumers reporting they were mobile-only for voice calls in 2020.", "Andrew Williams,\u00a0the acting chief executive of ACCAN,\u00a0said coverage maps were hard to read and \"confusing\".", "\"Some of the maps cover internal or inside access, others are only for outside connection so what we'd really like to see in the upgraded maps is more data and more detail so people can make some informed decisions,\" he said.", "", "
Armstrong Creek is wedged between Geelong's south and the north of Torquay.\u00a0\u00a0(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "The Australian Consumer and Competition Commission's (ACCC)\u00a02021 Mobile Infrastructure Report said\u00a0mobile providers used different criteria to predict their coverage when creating coverage maps.\u00a0", "The report recommended companies \"collaborate\" on a common set of assumptions for predicting coverage so customers, especially in regional areas, can make \"informed choices\".", "The federal government has invested $380 million\u00a0in its Mobile Black Spot Program, but Armstrong Creek isn't designated regional status, instead, it's classified as \"peri-urban\" meaning the suburb is ineligible for funding.", "
Going back to landlines
", "Federal member for Corangamite Libby Coker has spoken to dozens of families about the lack of coverage and said she had raised the issue with mobile companies.", "She said mobile companies that didn't provide reliable reception should reimburse customers.", "She said one woman she spoke to had to be at the other end of the house from where her husband had collapsed so she could get instructions\u00a0from a\u00a0triple-0 operator.\u00a0", "That scenario was what Denise Oliveri feared most when her husband Ray was diagnosed with early-onset Alzheimer's disease seven years ago.\u00a0", "Denise lives in Warralily \u2014\u00a0another estate in Armstrong Creek \u2014\u00a0and bought four landline phones so if Ray needed an ambulance, she wouldn't need to go to the street to call one.\u00a0", "", "
Denise Oliveri's late husband, Ray, died of early-onset Alzheimer's disease last year.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "\"We just had to have it right from the start. You would talk to someone and it would drop out or they couldn't hear you,\" Mrs Oliveri said.", "She said the landlines became \"an absolute necessity\".", "\"If I wasn't here I needed to know how he was at all times. And if a carer needed me they needed to be able to contact me.\"", "But even then, with four cordless landlines dotted around the house, the connection\u00a0wasn't 100 per cent reliable and dropped out if the internet went down.", "\"The anxiety starts again, but it only happened a few times and it was much more reliable than a mobile service,\" Denise said.\u00a0", "", "
Denise\u00a0Oliveri bought four landline phones to make sure she could call triple-0 in an emergency.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "
Families packing up
", "As much as she'd like her to stay, Tamika's mum can't live with the family forever.", "Tamika has now called her property manager to say the family will be breaking their lease.\u00a0", "\"It would cost the\u00a0same to move as it would to change providers,\" Tamika said.", "", "
Tamika Cefai\u00a0struggled with five daughters in the house last year and asked her mum to move in for company.(ABC News: Rachel Clayton)
", "She's sad to leave. The area is filled with new parents and young kids, she said, but that's also the reason why connectivity desperately needs to be upgraded.\u00a0", "\"It's such an already trying time \u2026 that communication is so important during those early years.\"", "Denise is leaving too.", "Ray passed away last year\u00a0and the\u00a0house has become too big for just Denise,\u00a0so she's moving a few kilometres away to be closer to her daughter.\u00a0", "The new house is still in Armstrong Creek and a little closer to a tower, she said.\u00a0", "\"I'm hoping the phone reception is going to be a bit better there.\"", "But she's taking the landlines with her, just in case."]
